intro: Aciotis laxa, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to violet in color. Aciotis laxa is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
